title.narrative: Improving the Disadvantaged Farm Households' Capacity in Long An Province through VBHCD

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to improve farm household capacity in Binh Duc commune, Ben Luc District, Long An Province in the Mekong Delta. A total of 160 families—80 original and 80 who will benefit through Passing on the Gift— will be divided into eight self-help groups (SHGs). The SHGs will be trained on Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, Participatory Self-review Planning (PSRP) method and the Values-based Holistic Community Development (VBHCD) model. This project will provide 80 heifers to 80 families. In addition to animal distribution, participants will receive training on livestock management, aquaculture, crop production, sustainable agriculture skills, enterprise development, and natural resource management among others. Original families will also receive micro-credit funds of $167 per family for initiating income generating activities such as poultry raising, fish raising, cash crop cultivation or petty trade. In addition to the livestock and training, they will also pass on the micro-credit fund. In three years the project will create the sustainable development for its members during and after the project period. The project will also train the youth in the project communities. The youth will be the bridge for the project to access to other youth in and out the communities. They will pass on the gift trough their daily Cornerstones practice, which will inspire other youth communities.
